column1: Chatsworth is a city in Murray County
column3: United States. It is part of the Dalton

column6: 299 in 2010. The city is the county seat of Murray County.It is the site of the coldest temperature in Georgia

column2: the town received its name after a road sign with the word "Chatsworth" fell off a passing freight train nearby. Someone put the sign on a post
column3: and the name stuck.Just east of Chatsworth are Fort Mountain and the Fort Mountain State Park.

column1: Founded in 1905 as a depot on the Louisville and Nashville Railroad. It was incorporated as a town in 1906 and as a city in 1923. In 1915
column2: the seat of Murray County transferred to Chatsworth from Spring Place.
